description: VFG000530(gb|NP_461787) (sprB) transcriptional regulator [TTSS (SPI-1 encode) (VF0116) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2]

description: VFG000535(gb|NP_461794) (prgI) type III secretion system needle filament protein PrgI [TTSS (SPI-1 encode) (VF0116) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2]

description: VFG013281(gb|WP_005694030) (lpt6) phosphoethanolamine (Petn) transferase [LOS (VF0044) - Immune modulation (VFC0258)] [Haemophilus influenzae Rd KW20]

Structure should feature a catalytic domain with appropriate active site residues for phosphotransfer activity, likely adopting a globular fold with membrane-associated regions for LOS substrate interaction. The protein should demonstrate specificity for LOS modification sites and maintain proper subcellular localization to the bacterial inner membrane or periplasmic space. Include conserved sequence motifs for enzyme activity and substrate binding while ensuring the overall architecture supports efficient transfer of phosphoethanolamine to LOS, contributing to the bacterium's ability to evade host immune detection and establish infection.

description: VFG000820(gb|WP_000087467) (cesD) chaperone for EspB and EspD [TTSS (VF0191) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Escherichia coli O157:H7 str. EDL933]

description: VFG013271(gb|WP_005694044) (kdkA) 3-deoxy-D-manno-octulosonic-acid kinase [LOS (VF0044) - Immune modulation (VFC0258)] [Haemophilus influenzae Rd KW20]

description: VFG041257(gb|WP_010946432) (ankN/ankX/legA8) Dot/Icm Type IV secretion system effector AnkX ankyrin repeat-containing protein, phosphoryl transferase [Dot/Icm T4SS secreted effectors (VF0798) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Legionella pneumophila subsp. pneumophila str. description: VFG047834(gb|WP_003016192) (vgrG) Type VI secretion system secreted protein VgrG [T6SS (VF0544) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Francisella tularensis subsp. tularensis SCHU S4]

description: VFG043349(gb|WP_010947508) (LPG_RS08925) RNA polymerase sigma factor FliA [Flagella (VF0157) - Motility (VFC0204)] [Legionella pneumophila subsp. pneumophila str. Philadelphia 1]

description: VFG048951(gb|WP_015875028) (KP1_RS17330) polysaccharide biosynthesis tyrosine autokinase [Capsule (VF0560) - Immune modulation (VFC0258)] [Klebsiella pneumoniae subsp. pneumoniae NTUH-K2044]

description: VFG013276(gb|WP_010868969) (opsX/rfaC) heptosyltransferase I  [LOS (VF0044) - Immune modulation (VFC0258)] [Haemophilus influenzae Rd KW20]
prompt: Design a protein sequence for heptosyltransferase I (also known as opsX/rfaC) from Haemophilus influenzae strain Rd KW20. This enzyme is a critical virulence factor that functions in the biosynthesis of lipooligosaccharide (LOS), a major surface glycolipid that mimics host structures to evade immune recognition. Heptosyltransferase I catalyzes the transfer of the first heptose sugar from ADP-heptose to the inner core region of the LOS, specifically to the Kdo (3-deoxy-D-manno-oct-2-ulosonic acid) residue. This initial heptosylation step is essential for the subsequent addition of further heptose residues and other sugar modifications that complete the LOS core oligosaccharide. The enzyme belongs to the glycosyltransferase family and likely contains conserved motifs for nucleotide sugar binding and substrate recognition. It is an integral membrane protein localized to the cytoplasmic membrane, with multiple transmembrane domains that anchor it to the inner membrane, and a large periplasmic domain that houses the catalytic site. The protein should exhibit structural features typical of processive glycosyltransferases, including a Rossmann-like fold for ADP-heptose binding and specific residues for coordinating the sugar donor and acceptor substrates. The sequence must ensure proper integration into the membrane and correct orientation of the active site toward the periplasmic space where LOS assembly occurs. The functional integrity of this enzyme is crucial for Haemophilus influenzae pathogenesis, as defects in LOS biosynthesis impair bacterial survival in the host and reduce virulence by compromising immune evasion mechanisms.

description: VFG039141(gb|NP_820611) (icmL.1/dotI) Type IVB secretion system protein IcmL [Dot/Icm T4SS (VF0503) - Effector delivery system (VFC0086)] [Coxiella burnetii RSA 493]

description: VFG043361(gb|WP_010948025) (motB) flagellar motor protein MotB [Flagella (VF0157) - Motility (VFC0204)] [Legionella pneumophila subsp. pneumophila str. Philadelphia 1]

Based on its role in siderophore biosynthesis, BasJ should contain conserved domains characteristic of nonribosomal peptide synthetase (NRPS) accessory proteins or siderophore biosynthesis enzymes, potentially including substrate-binding pockets, catalytic residues for acyl transfer or condensation reactions, and interaction surfaces with other Bas pathway components. The protein should exhibit structural features enabling its integration into the multi-enzyme acinetobactin biosynthesis complex, with appropriate secondary structure elements and tertiary folding to support its enzymatic function. The sequence must reflect a cytoplasmic localization with proper solubility characteristics for efficient siderophore production, while maintaining the specific functional motifs required for iron-scavenging virulence activity in the competitive host environment.

description: VFG002554(gb|WP_011205222) (gmhA) phosphoheptose isomerase [Capsule I (VF0436) - Immune modulation (VFC0258)] [Burkholderia pseudomallei K96243]
prompt: Design a functional phosphoheptose isomerase enzyme from the highly virulent bacterial pathogen Burkholderia pseudomallei. The protein should be cytoplasmic-localized since it operates in the central metabolic pathway for capsule precursor synthesis. Design this enzyme to be highly specific for its heptose substrate while maintaining the structural stability required for function in the intracellular environment of this dangerous Category B select agent pathogen.
